greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) = Number of permutations of 1..n+2*k-1 with each element displaced by at least k.
link: R. H. Hardin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..201
example: All permutations of 1-5 with minimum displacement 2:
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Permanent[nrows = n+2k-1; Table[If[Abs[i-j] <= k-1, 0, 1], {i, 1, nrows}, {j, 1, nrows}]]; Table[t = T[n-k+1, k]; Print[ "T(", n-k+1, ",", k, ") = ", t]; t, {n, 1, 9}, {k, n, 1, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 07 2016, adapted from Sage *)
program: return Matrix(lambda i,j: 0 if abs(i-j) <= (k-1) else 1, nrows=n+2*k-1).permanent() # _D. S. McNeil_, Jan 04 2011
results.author: _R. H. Hardin_, Jan 03 2011
